entries.name: Brittle
entries: You are vulnerable to bludgeoning damage, but resistant to slashing and piercing damage.

entries.name: Undead
entries: You are considered undead not humanoid for spells and effects.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: You are immune to disease and the poisoned condition, and you have resistance to poison damage. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food or drink if you wish. Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state, but resting in this way is otherwise identical to sleeping. Magically induced sleep can cause you to enter this inactive state.

entries.name: Bonepile
entries: When reduced to 0 hp instead of making death saves you can choose to fall prone to a pile of magical bones while in this state you can not move or take actions except to end the effect and you are immune to all damage and conditions. A dispel magic or similar effect will end this effect early.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, and one other language that your creator knew

entries.name: Size
entries: Skeletons are usually made from a human corpse and thus are usually around 5 or 6 ft. Your size is Medium. A human skeleton is usually around 20 or 30 lbs.

entries.name: Age
entries: Skeletons don’t age, they can theoretically live forever. They appear the same as when they were created.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most skeletons are evil and corrupted by the necromantic energy that fuels them. They are usually created with a purpose in mind or to do a necromancers bidding.

spell.name: Negative Energy Binding

components.m: A small piece of troll’s flesh

entries: When you cast this spell your weapon or ammunition becomes coated in necrotic energy that drains the healing energy of any creatures it attaches to.

On each of your turns for the duration, the first time you hit a creature with a weapon attack you deal an additional 1d8 necrotic damage. When a creature is hit by this effect the energy attaches to the creature and it can’t regain hit points until the spell ends or you the energy binds to a new creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher increase the damage it deals by 1d8 for each spell level above 1st.

default: (a) a {@item shortbow|phb} and {@item quiver|phb} of {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows} or (b) a {@item shortsword|phb}
(a) a {@item burglar's pack|phb}, (b) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}, or (c) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
{@item Leather armor|phb}, two {@item dagger|phb|daggers}, and {@item metallurgy kit|AudXHomebrew}

classFeatures.name: Expertise
entries: At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with {@item metallurgy kit|AudXHomebrew}. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
At 6th level, you can choose one more of your proficiencies (in skills or with {@item metallurgy kit|AudXHomebrew}) to gain this benefit.

classFeatures.name: Allomancy
entries: At 1st level, you gain access to allomancy and learn the first ability of each of the metals. You choose a new allomantic ability each level.

Metals when consumed stay as a reserve of charges within the user until they start a long rest or are burned away. As an action you can expend one charge to begin burning, if the duration would end and you have a charge available you can expend the charge to continue the burn using no action.
At the start of each day you use must spend 1 hour with your metallurgy kit preparing a number of vials equal to your level + your intelligence modifier (minimum +1).

Ask your DM: If they allow you may be able to buy or find extra vials of metal in the world or even create your own vials though balancing this can be difficult and extra work. I suggest having metal vials that don't expire show up around the world in the place of potions. If you attempt to burn a metal that is not pure but close to the metal you can burn, it can be dangerous. Possibly poisoning you, dealing damage or even killing you.

classFeatures.name: Metallurgy
entries: At 1st level, as a Mistborn understanding how metal vials are made is important. Not all mistborn are experts with metallurgy kits but each one should know how to make their own metals and how to properly combine different metals into a single vial, you gain proficiency with the metallurgy kit.

classFeatures.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

entries.name: Thrown Weapons
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make when throwing a weapon or using your steal/iron attacks and saves.

entries.name: Unarmored Fighter
entries: While you are not wearing armor or weilding a shield, your AC equals 10 + Dex + half your proficiency bonus (rounded up).

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Mariner
entries: As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you have a swimming speed and a climbing speed equal to your normal speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

entries.name: Superior Technique
entries: You learn one {@filter maneuver|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV;MV:B} of your choice from among those available to the Battle Master archetype. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain one superiority die, which is a {@dice d6} (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Blind Fighting
entries: Being unable to see a creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls against it, provided the creature isn't hidden from you.

entries.name: Interception
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target that is within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by {@dice 1d10} + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a shield or a simple or martial weapon to use this reaction.

entries.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon.
In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Unarmed Fighting
entries: Your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier. If you strike with two free hands, the {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}.

When you successfully start a grapple, you can deal {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage to the grappled creature. Until the grapple ends, you can also deal this damage to the creature whenever you hit it with a melee attack.

classFeatures.name: Allomantic Specialty
entries: At 3rd level, you choose one of the subsets of allomancy to focus on as your primary Physical (steel, iron, Pewter, Tin) Mental (Zinc, Brass, Copper, Bronze), Enhancement (Nicrosil, Aluminium, Aluminum, Chromium), Temporal (Electrum, Gold, Bendalloy, Cadmium).

When you choose this and again at levels 6, 9, 13, 17 you can choose an extra ability from your chosen subset. If you already have all of the available abilities from your subset choose a second subset to specialize in and so forth.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 12th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeatures.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeatures.name: Expertise
entries: At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with {@item thieves' tools|phb}) to gain the benefit of Expertise.

classFeatures.name: Evasion
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or an {@spell ice storm} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

Burning metals only takes you a bonus action and you can begin burning metals when initiative is rolled by expending 1 charge of the metals you want to begin burning.

classFeatures.name: Natural Reserve
entries: At 14th level your body has grown accustomed to the metals you burn and has grown resistant to the poisons they can cause. Before each long rest you may choose 1 vial of metal to not lose at the start of the long rest. You can also continue or start burning metals while you are unconscious.
You also have advantage against saving throws against poisons and disease.

classFeatures.name: Metallic Specialist
entries: At 15th level choose one of the 16 metals and vials of that metal are treated as if they had 4x the charges. When you finish a short rest you increase your reserves to one vial's worth of charges if you had less.

classFeatures.name: Forked Tongue
entries: You have a facility with speech and know how to manipulate an audience. Whenever you make an ability check to persuade, deceive, or intimidate, you can treat a d20 roll of 7 or lower as an 8.
Additionally you learn the Infernal language.

classFeatures.name: Infernal Conduit
entries: There is a pool of infernal power within you that replenishes after you take a long rest. This pool is represented by dice, starting with 1d10 at 1st level. Your pool gains dice as shown on the Illrigger table. With these dice you can transfer hit points between your illrigger and other targets, healing allies at the expense of your own health or draining the life force of enemies to rejuvenate your own vitality.

As an action, choose a number of dice from your remaining pool and touch another creature. If they are unwilling, this is a melee spell attack with which you are proficient, using Charisma as your spell-casting ability. If you miss, nothing happens you do not roll or lose dice from your pool. If you hit, or if you’re targeting a willing creature, roll the chosen dice. The result of your roll is the number of hit points you transfer. If you’re touching an ally, they gain that many hit points, ignoring any hit points in excess of their maximum. You lose hit points equal to the number of hit points they gained. If your sacrifice reduces you to 0 hit points, you fall unconscious. If you’re touching an enemy, they take necrotic damage equal to your roll, and you gain that many hit points. If you would gain hit points in excess of your maximum, you gain that number of temporary hit points instead.

Beginning at 11th level, in addition to draining the life force of an enemy, you can also inflict one level of exhaustion on them. They may recover this exhaustion normally. This ability does not work if the target already has three or more levels of exhaustion, or if you have no dice left in your pool, and you cannot choose to inflict exhaustion instead of draining life.

classFeatures.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd leve you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following Illrigger options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

entries.name: Treachery
entries: When you attack an enemy who has none of your allies adjacent to it, you gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls.

entries.name: Bravado
entries: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Schemes
entries: While you wield a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you can use your reaction after an adjacent enemy attacks you to move into any other unoccupied space within five feet of the attacking enemy. This movement does not provoke an opportunity attack.

entries.name: Lies
entries: When you attack with a two-handed melee weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of your Strength modifier, for both the attack and damage rolls.

classFeatures.name: Baleful Interdict
entries: When you reach 2nd level, you learn to use the power of Hell to censure other creatures. As a bonus action, you can place a seal on a target you can see within 30 feet. You can do this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain all your seals. When you or an ally hits a target you can see with any seals on it, you can consume the seals to make the attack deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to the target per seal consumed.
If you are within 30 feet of the target, you regain 2 hit points for each die of damage your seals deals.
A creature with a seal on them is an interdicted creature.

Seals evaporate if not used after 1 minute. Only the illrigger who placed the seal knows it’s there; it appears to the illrigger as a glowing glyph on the creature’s forehead. If a creature with any of your seals on it dies, you can move all of its seals to another creature within range.

When you reach 10th level, you feel your connection to your archdevil increase. Your seals deal anextra 1d6 damage. Your seals improve differently based on which contract you choose. These improvements are listed under “Diabolic Contract,” below.

classFeatures.name: Hellsight
entries: When you reach 3rd level, your mastery of deception makes it easy for you to recognize the use of concealing sorcery. As an action, you extend your awareness out from you. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of creatures within 60 feet using magic to hide or disguise themselves.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. When you finish a long rest, you regain your expended uses.

baseitem.name: Metallurgy Kit
entries: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of weights and scales, chemicals used to clean metals, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to analyze or craft metal vials.
additionalEntries: Perhaps the most common tools used by adventurers, metallurgy kit are designed for picking locks and foiling traps. Proficiency with the tools also grants you a general knowledge of traps and locks.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Metallurgy Kits includes a small file, a set of weights and scales, chemicals used to clean metals, and a pair of pliers.

additionalEntries.name: History
entries: Your knowledge of metallurgy grants you insight when answering questions about allomancy.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation and Perception
entries: You gain additional insight when looking for metals or to check the quality of a metal vial, because you have learned a variety of common signs that betray their presence.

additionalEntries.name: Craft a vial of metals
entries: You can attempt to prepare a vial of metals or craft a packet of metal dust. With at least one packet of metals and a vial you can make a check adding your metallurgy kit bonus. If you roll below a 9 you prepare one vial, if you roll below a 19 you prepare 2, anything higher and you prepare 3. Given a source of metal you can make the same check to attempt to extract the metal to create a metals packet.

item.name: Mistcloak
entries: Worn to obscure their figure and so prevent them from being seen. It is a hooded garment made from a lightweight material, and consisted of ribbonlike strips of dark gray cloth sewn together at the shoulders and chest.[1] Mistcloaks are constructed to come free when pulled, so that they cannot be used against the wearer in combat.

While in dim or dark light when wearing this you can use an action to pull the hood up and the cloak tight around you, shrouding yourself in the cloak, it stays this way until you make an attack or cast a spell. While in this state you have advantage on stealth checks and attacks have disadvantage to hit you.
You gain +1 to your AC while wearing this with light armor or no armor.

optionalfeature.name: Steel Misting - Coinshot
entries: Steel is one of the most complicated allomantic abilities it allows the user to burn steel to push metals away in a straight line from the user's center of gravity there are 2 general rules for steelpushing, which also apply to ironpulling, its paired opposite. The first rule is that the strength of your push is roughly proportional to your physical weight. This means that larger Allomancers can generally steelpush and ironpull more powerfully than a smaller counterpart. While proportional, the force exerted by a steelpush is much greater than the Coinshot's weight, allowing them to push themselves into the air by pushing on a piece of metal that is on the ground (or is anchored to something that weighs more than they do). The second rule is that metal that is at least partially inside a person's body cannot be affected by steel. Both of these rules can be overcome by a sufficiently strong Coinshot, however.
When you take this ability you gain {@optionalfeature Steel Basic|AudXHomebrew}.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Misting - Lurcher
entries: One of the most complicated allowmantic abilities it allows the art of burning iron to pull metals away in a straight line from the user's center of gravity. There are two general rules for ironpulling, which also apply to steelpushing, its paired opposite. The first rule is that the strength of your pull is roughly proportional to your physical mass. This means that larger Allomancers can generally ironpull and steelpush more powerfully than a smaller counterpart. While proportional, the force exerted by an ironpull is much greater than the Lurcher's weight, allowing them to pull themselves through the air by pulling on a piece of metal that weighs more than they do (or is anchored to something that does). The second rule is that metal that is at least partially inside a person's body cannot be affected by iron.

optionalfeature.name: Pewter Misting - Pewterarm
entries: Also known as a Pewterarm. Pewter's utility is not simply from the increased strength or speed. It grants the user the ability to heal from otherwise deadly wounds, and to recover much quicker. Aluminum in a wound will make it impossible for the Thug to heal the injury around the metal for as long as it remains in the body. Pewter also enhances the body's natural balance, granting almost unnaturally smooth movements. It also increases reaction speed and gives them resistance to hot and cold temperatures. Finally, it increases endurance, letting the body continue on long past when it would have normally shut down. Pewter can be dangerous when it runs out, which is a serious concern since it is the fastest-burning of the eight basic metals. A Thug having just survived a deadly wound can die from the resulting effects when the body runs out of pewter to burn. However, the body will naturally burn pewter in an attempt to heal itself, so even an unconscious Thug can be given additional pewter to survive otherwise life-threatening situations.

By constantly flaring pewter for a long time (pewter dragging), a Thug can achieve incredible things, such as running at roughly the speed of a galloping horse for extended periods. However, this is extremely dangerous and could even be lethal when the Thug stops burning pewter, for they would suffer from the sudden burst of fatigue which was suppressed by pewter. Several days of rest and sufficient food are required to replenish the Thug afterwards.
When you take this ability you gain Pewter Basic.
